marketNews.title: One of Indonesia's Largest Nickel<bos> Smelters Reportedly Nearing Shutdown
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reports that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry, which is one of the largest nickel smelter companies in Indonesia, has cut production and is on the verge of completely halting its production. This news surfaced only a few months after its parent company in China, Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry Co., filed for bankruptcy. Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry itself is the third-largest stainless steel producer in China. Bloomberg sources stated that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry has delayed payments to local energy suppliers and has been unable to secure nickel ore, consequently shutting down almost all of its production lines since early 2025. Bloomberg noted that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry has a total production capacity of 1.8 million tons per year of nickel pig iron. Besides PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry, Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry is also known to own several nickel smelter businesses and stainless steel plants in Indonesia, such as PT Virtue Dragon Nickel Industry and PT Obsidian Stainless Steel. According to a Reuters report in July 2024, one of the factors driving the bankruptcy of Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry was the deteriorating performance of its joint venture in Indonesia due to declining ferronickel prices and rising material costs at the end of 2023. In the same report, Reuters also mentioned that several industry players anticipate that Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry's operations in China will be partially taken over by Chinese State-Owned Enterprises. An analyst from CRU Group consultancy, Kevin Bai, told Reuters that companies like Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry are too big to fail and the bankruptcy reorganization process is not new in China.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Nickel Pig Iron Supply Reduction Risk
marketNews.content: The production cut by PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry has the potential to reduce the supply of nickel pig iron from Indonesia, which could cause a global increase in the price of this commodity considering Indonesia's status as the world's largest nickel pig iron producer. The smelter capacity of PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry alone is equivalent to ~20% of Indonesia's total nickel pig iron production capacity, which reaches 9 million tons per year, based on data as of 2022. Meanwhile, the price of nickel pig iron has slowly strengthened +4.5% YTD. Today, Friday (21/2), the stock prices of nickel producers collectively strengthened, with $NCKL +7.26% and $INCO +4.45%, while $MBMA briefly rose +3.18% to the level of 390 rupiah per share before closing flat.

marketNews.title: SMDR Enters as Container Operator at Patimban Port
marketNews.content: Katadata reports that Samudera Indonesia through its subsidiary, PT Samudera Pelabuhan Indonesia, has completed the acquisition of new shares in PT Patimban Global Gateway Terminal - the operator of the container terminal at Patimban Port - for an undisclosed value. This corporate action was carried out jointly with Africa Global Logistics SAS (AGL) and Toyota Tsusho Corporation (TTC), with SMDR's ownership in PT Patimban Global Gateway Terminal through its subsidiary reaching 21%, while AGL and TTC ownership reached 45% and 34% respectively. PT Patimban Global Terminal is scheduled to begin commercial operations in 2026 and will manage the container terminal at Patimban Port for 37 years. The container terminal of PT Patimban Global Terminal will be developed gradually until reaching a target capacity of 3.7 million TEUs.

marketNews.title: Students Protest Budget Overhaul in Jakarta and Other Cities
marketNews.content: Students demonstrated in Jakarta and several other cities on Thursday (20/2) to protest the budget overhaul under President Prabowo Subianto's administration, which is feared to disrupt social protection, threaten contract workers' jobs, and revoke scholarships. In a series of protests known on social media as 'Indonesia Gelap' (Dark Indonesia), students asked President Prabowo to review the free meal program and cancel the plan to cut the budget amounting to 306.7 trillion rupiah. The 'Indonesia Gelap' protests were still ongoing on Friday (21/2) involving several civil society coalitions. Regarding the government's commitment to fiscal stability, the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated on Thursday (20/2) that the government plans to issue jumbo bonds to fund the program of building 3 million houses per year, although she did not specify the amount. The funds raised from these bonds will later be used to increase subsidies for housing financing liquidity facilities (FLPP) on a larger scale. On the same occasion, the Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, mentioned that Bank Indonesia will purchase these bonds in the secondary market. Previously, Perry stated in December 2024 that his party would purchase Indonesian government bonds worth 150 trillion rupiah in the secondary market in 2025, of which 100 trillion rupiah would be used for debt switching of bonds with a burden sharing scheme between the government and Bank Indonesia during the Covid-19 era.

marketNews.title: Government Debt Ratio and Revenue Ratio Update
marketNews.content: The Minister of Finance's Expert Staff, Parjiono, stated on Thursday (20/2) that the government debt to GDP ratio rose to 39.36% in 2024 (vs. 2023: 39.21% of GDP), while the revenue to GDP ratio fell to 12.84% (vs. 2023: 13.33% of GDP). Existing regulations limit the maximum government debt ratio to 60% of GDP. Meanwhile, the Deputy Coordinator at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Ferry Irawan, mentioned that the government is committed to maintaining fiscal stability, one way being through debt ratio control next year. The government projects the debt to GDP ratio to be in the range of 37.82-38.71% in 2025.

marketNews.title: Proposal to Abolish Subsidized Fuel by 2027
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the National Economic Council, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated on Thursday (20/2) that he had proposed to President Prabowo Subianto to abolish subsidized fuel by 2027 and replace it with direct cash assistance. Previously, the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated in early January 2025 that a new scheme for channeling fuel subsidies would be announced soon. Bahlil also mentioned on Friday (21/2) that the blending scheme - where subsidy channeling will combine fuel price subsidies and direct cash assistance - remains the most potential scheme to be implemented in 2025, but he could not provide a definite start date for the scheme's implementation.

marketNews.title: Revision of Oil and Gas Law to be Discussed Starting April 2025
marketNews.content: A member of the House of Representatives (DPR), Eddy Soeparno, stated on Thursday (20/1) that they would start discussing the revision of the Oil and Gas Law no later than April 2025. Responding to this, the Chairman of the Investment Committee of the Oil and Gas Companies Association, Moshe Rizal, criticized that every year the Oil and Gas Bill is always called urgent, but in fact, it has never been passed. According to Moshe, one factor hindering the ratification of the Gas and Oil Law amendment is the debate within the government regarding how the government will manage the oil and gas sector going forward, not related to investor interests.

marketNews.title: Government to Conduct Market Operations to Stabilize Food Prices Before Ramadan
marketNews.content: The Minister of Agriculture, Andi Amran Sulaiman, stated that the government will conduct market operations to stabilize food prices ahead of Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr. Amran also mentioned that President Prabowo Subianto has ordered that the prices of basic necessities must not exceed the highest retail price (HET). The Head of the National Food Agency, Arief Prasetyo Adi, stated that market operations will run from February 24, 2025, until the end of March 2025. Kompas reported that these market operations will be supported by the network of the Indonesian Retailers Association, Charoen Pokphand Indonesia ($CPIN), and Japfa Comfeed Indonesia ($JPFA), as well as 452 food kiosks across 31 provinces and 102 districts/cities.

marketNews.title: Freeport Indonesia Receives Final Copper Concentrate Export Relaxation Until June 2025
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Friday (21/2) that the government has granted copper concentrate export permits to PT Freeport Indonesia until June 2025, which is the target completion time for the repair of the company's smelter at KEK JIIPE, Gresik, following a fire in October 2024. The granting of this permit takes into account that the fire at the smelter was caused by force majeure. Bahlil mentioned that if PT Freeport Indonesia has not completed the smelter repairs by June 2025, the government will impose sanctions in the form of a 'maximum export tax.'

marketNews.title: PDI-P Secretary General Hasto Kristiyanto Detained by KPK; Megawati Directs Party Operations
marketNews.content: The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) detained the Secretary General of the Indonesian struggle Democratic Party (PDI-P), Hasto Kristiyanto, on Thursday (20/2) on charges of bribery regarding the processing of DPR members for the 2019-2024 period and obstruction of investigation in the same case. Following this, PDI-P did not appoint an acting secretary general, with the PDI-P General Chairman, Megawati Soekarnoputri, directly taking command of the party. Megawati also instructed all regional heads and deputy regional heads from PDI-P to postpone their travel to the regional heads' retreat activity in Magelang, Central Java, on February 21-28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific Clarifies Infrastructure Subsidiary IPO Exploration
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific stated in a clarification to the IDX that its infrastructure investment subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, is indeed exploring the possibility of an IPO plan, although this is still in the internal discussion stage so it cannot be confirmed when the corporate action will be implemented. TPIA's latest classification is not much different from the company's statement in the information disclosure in August 2024. The new clarification from TPIA emerged after Katadata reported this week that TPIA plans to bring PT Chandra Daya Investasi for an IPO on the IDX before mid-2025.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources States Amman Mineral Has Not Applied for Concentrator Export Relaxation
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that Amman Mineral Internasional has not yet applied for relaxation of copper concentrate exports. Bahlil's statement emerged after $AMMN through its subsidiary, PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara, hoped to obtain copper concentrate export relaxation along with the smelter commissioning process running slower than planned.

tickerNews.title: Jababeka Industrial Estate Records 2024 Marketing Sales Above Target and Sets 2025 Target
tickerNews.content: $KIJA: Kawasan Industri Jababeka recorded marketing sales of 3.19 trillion rupiah throughout 2024 (+44% YoY), exceeding (106%) the 2024 target which was upgraded to 3 trillion rupiah. This result was supported by marketing sales growth in each region, namely Kendal (+73% YoY), Cikarang (+3% YoY), and Tanjung Lesung (+77% YoY). KIJA targets marketing sales of 3.5 trillion rupiah in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Sarana Mitra Luas Director Increases Direct Shareholding via Stock Purchase
tickerNews.content: $SMIL: The controller and President Director of Sarana Mitra Luas, Hadi Suhermin, purchased approximately 67.9 million SMIL shares at an average price of 294 rupiah per share on February 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 20 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hadi Suhermin's direct ownership in SMIL increased from 49.31% to 50.08%.

tickerNews.title: AKR Corporindo Commissioner Increases Direct Shareholding via Stock Purchase
tickerNews.content: $AKRA: The controller and President Commissioner of AKR Corporindo, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo, purchased 916,000 AKRA shares at an average price of 1,115 rupiah per share on February 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo's direct ownership in AKRA increased from 0.646% to 0.651%.

tickerNews.title: Menn Teknologi Indonesia Control Will Change Following 67% Stake Sale to Six Companies; Mandatory Tender Offer Expected
tickerNews.content: $MENN: Menn Teknologi Indonesia announced that 6 companies have purchased 67% of MENN shares for an undisclosed amount from 3 directors and commissioners of the company, consisting of Michael Halim Mulyanto, Edrick Pramana, and Agus Mulyanto. The 6 companies consist of PT Penajam Makmur Jaya, PT Negara Maju Makmur, PT Sarjana Sama Indah, PT Kalimantan Sejahtera Indonesia, PT Kalimantan Indah Kedepan, and PT Sarana Majemuk Indonesia. After this transaction, the controller in MENN will change, so the purchasing parties will conduct a mandatory tender offer for the company's shares.

tickerNews.title: Significant Shareholding Changes in PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra and Eveline Listijosuputro in PADI
tickerNews.content: $PADI: PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra purchased 650 million shares of Minna Padi Investama Sekuritas at an average price of 15 rupiah per share on February 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 9.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra's ownership in PADI increased from none previously to 5.75%. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Eveline Listijosuputro's ownership in PADI decreased from 2.92% to 1.81%.
